intro: Apinagia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian apinagia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Apinagia boliviana is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its alpine habitat.
